answers.answer: Weight is not related to thyroid based on this.Consider general endocrine evaluation to screen for pre-diabetes/insulin resistance and high cortisol (not common) as possible causes.

question: I am having great difficulty losing weight, despite two months of eating an 800-900 calorie diet that has approx 50gms of lean and mostly vegitable protien, low glycenic high fiber carbs, and omega fats that are very limited daily.  I am 51 year old and over 200 pounds. I am lucky to lose one pound a week or evey two weeks.  My recent blood report :T4 total  at 2:15 pm was on the higher side at 13.8TSH 2:25 pm was 1.33 and at 2:58 pm was 2.09T3 free  was 270Thyroid Autoantibodies 22Total Cortisol at 12:15pm was 15.9I am trying so hard to lose weight yet the only thing that was elevated was T4. I would appreciate any insite you could offer to me on this.  Thank you greatly for your advice.
title: weight loss difficulty
